intro: Pleiarina floridana, commonly known as the Florida pleiara, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils near freshwater habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
